definition: flat/level/equal/to tie (make the same score)/to draw (score)/calm/peaceful/see also 平聲|平声[ping2 sheng1]
office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.chinese: 中国队和巴西队打成平局。

sentences.english: This was the first historical draw of the Veneti in Turin.
sentences.chinese: 这是双方在都灵交锋上的第一次平局。

sentences.english: There has not been a draw between the teams at Fulham in the Premier League.
sentences.chinese: 英超历史上两队在富勒姆的主场还未打成平局。

sentences.english: Each variety had a different structure of rewards for winning, losing, or drawing.
sentences.chinese: 每一个变体各有不同的输赢或平局的奖励结构。

sentences.english: What's important is that we managed to move on after drawing our match in Santander.
sentences.chinese: 在与桑坦德战成平局后，我们要努力向前看更为重要。

sentences.english: Two badminton teams ended in a draw.
sentences.chinese: 两支羽毛球队打成平局。

sentences.english: The game ended in a tie, like the baseball allstar game?
sentences.chinese: 比赛在平局中结束了，就像是棒球的全明星赛？

sentences.english: The first televised debate between candidates for the chancellorship was judged a draw last night.
sentences.chinese: 昨晚竞选长官职位的第一场电视辩论以平局告终。

sentences.english: We've stayed on deuce for 5 minutes.
sentences.chinese: 这个平局状态我们已经保持了5分钟了。

sentences.english: In Playoffs, if a draw occurs, MR3 will be played.
sentences.chinese: 在季后赛，如果平局出现，将会进行MR3的加赛。

sentences.english: Cafu hopes that this will motivate the team to win the game following the draw against Ascoli in the first matchday.
sentences.chinese: 卡福希望第一场比赛的平局将激发球队取得胜利。

sentences.english: The World Cup opening game ends in a tie/draw .
sentences.chinese: 世界杯揭幕战以平局收场。

sentences.english: The used to call it a draw, when two horses finished neck and neck.
sentences.chinese: 两匹马并排跑到终点，他们过去常把这叫做平局。

sentences.english: On that occasion, it ultimately didn't damage our championship dream.
sentences.chinese: 那个时候的平局终究没有影响我们夺标的梦想。

sentences.english: Well, either side could win it, or it could be a draw.
sentences.chinese: 两方中的一方会赢，否则就是一场平局。

sentences.english: A draw would not go down well anywhere except on the Fylde coast.
sentences.chinese: 一场平局不会令事情有任何好转，除了对黑池的一方。

definition: sports such as soccer, basketball and volleyball that use large balls/see also 小球[xiao3 qiu2]
to score a victory/to prevail over one's opponents
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
(sports) to go out of bounds/to go over the line/to qualify for the next round of competition/(Tw) (fig.) to make the grade/to achieve success
